title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: First, go DataSpace now set account. order connect CAVD DataSpace via DataSpaceR, need netrc file home directory contain machine name (hostname DataSpace), login password. two ways create netrc file.

what: Creating a netrc file with writeNetrc
title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: R console, create netrc file using function DataSpaceR: create netrc file home directory. Make sure valid login password.
code: writeNetrc(   login = "yourEmail@address.com",   password = "yourSecretPassword",   netrcFile = "/your/home/directory/.netrc" # use getNetrcPath() to get the default path )

title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: Alternatively, can manually create netrc file. Windows, file named _netrc UNIX/Mac, named .netrc file located user’s home directory, permissions file unreadable everybody except owner determine home directory, run Sys.getenv("HOME") R following three lines must included .netrc _netrc file either separated white space (spaces, tabs, newlines) commas. Multiple blocks can exist one file. See information netrc.
code: machine dataspace.cavd.org login myuser@domain.com password supersecretpassword

title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: ’ll looking study cvd256. want use different study, change string. can instantiate multiple connections different studies simultaneously. call connectDS instantiates connection. Printing object shows ’s connected available studies. con$availableStudies shows available studies CAVD DataSpace. Check reference page DataSpaceConnection available fields methods. con$getStudy creates connection study cvd256. Printing object shows ’s connected, study, available datasets. Available datasets treatment arm information connection can accessed availableDatasets treatmentArm.
code: library(DataSpaceR) con <- connectDS() con #> <DataSpaceConnection> #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org #>   User: jmtaylor@scharp.org #>   Available studies: 273 #>     - 77 studies with data #>     - 5049 subjects #>     - 423195 data points #>   Available groups: 3 #>   Available publications: 1530 #>     - 12 publications with data knitr::kable(head(con$availableStudies)) cvd256 <- con$getStudy("cvd256") cvd256 #> <DataSpaceStudy> #>   Study: cvd256 #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org/CAVD/cvd256 #>   Available datasets: #>     - Binding Ab multiplex assay #>     - Demographics #>     - Neutralizing antibody #>   Available non-integrated datasets: knitr::kable(cvd256$availableDatasets) knitr::kable(cvd256$treatmentArm)

title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: can grab datasets listed connection (availableDatasets). cvd256 object R6 class, behaves like true object. Functions (like getDataset) members object, thus $ semantics access member functions. can get detailed variable information using getDatasetDescription. getDataset getDatasetDescription accept either name label field listed availableDatasets. get subset data speed download, filters can passed getDataset. filters created using makeFilter function Rlabkey package. See ?makeFilter information syntax.
code: NAb <- cvd256$getDataset("NAb") dim(NAb) #> [1] 1419   33 colnames(NAb) #>  [1] "participant_id"      "participant_visit"   "visit_day"           #>  [4] "assay_identifier"    "summary_level"       "specimen_type"       #>  [7] "antigen"             "antigen_type"        "virus"               #> [10] "virus_type"          "virus_insert_name"   "clade"               #> [13] "neutralization_tier" "tier_clade_virus"    "target_cell"         #> [16] "initial_dilution"    "titer_ic50"          "titer_ic80"          #> [19] "response_call"       "nab_lab_source_key"  "lab_code"            #> [22] "exp_assayid"         "titer_id50"          "titer_id80"          #> [25] "nab_response_id50"   "nab_response_id80"   "slope"               #> [28] "vaccine_matched"     "study_prot"          "virus_full_name"     #> [31] "virus_species"       "virus_host_cell"     "virus_backbone" knitr::kable(cvd256$getDatasetDescription("NAb")) cvd256Filter <- makeFilter(c("visit_day", "EQUAL", "0")) NAb_day0 <- cvd256$getDataset("NAb", colFilter = cvd256Filter) dim(NAb_day0) #> [1] 709  33

what: Creating a connection to all studies
title: Introduction to DataSpaceR
text: fetch data multiple studies, create connection project level. instantiate connection CAVD level. functions work cross study connections just like single studies. can get list datasets available across studies. -study connection, getDataset combine requested datasets. Note cases, datasets many subjects quick data transfer, making filtering data necessity. colFilter argument can used , described getDataset section. Check reference page DataSpaceStudy available fields methods.

title: Accessing Monoclonal Antibody Data
text: Using DataSpace app, workflow using mAb grid following: Navigate mAb Grid browse available mAb mixtures Select mAb mixtures ’d like investigate mAb/Mixture donor species isotype HXB2 location tiers clades viruses Click “Neutralization Curves” “IC50 Titer Heatmap” visualize mAb data Click “Export CSV” “Export Excel” download mAb data DataSpaceR offers similar interface: Browse mAb Grid con$mabGridSummary Select mAb mixtures filtering mAb grid using columns found con$mabGrid using con$filterMabGrid() Use con$getMab() retrieve mAb data

title: Accessing Monoclonal Antibody Data
text: can browse mAb Grid calling mabGridSummary field connection object: table designed mimic mAb grid found app. One can also access unsummarized data mAb grid calling con$mabGrid.
code: library(DataSpaceR) con <- connectDS()  knitr::kable(head(con$mabGridSummary))

title: Accessing Monoclonal Antibody Data
text: can filter rows grid specifying values keep columns found field con$mabGrid: mab_mixture, donor_species, isotype, hxb2_location, tiers, clades, viruses, studies. filterMabGrid takes column values filters underlying tables (private fields), call mabGridSummary (actually active binding), returns filtered grid updated n_ columns geometric_mean_curve_ic50. can use method chaining call multiple filter methods browse grid. Method chaining unique R6 objects related pipe. See Hadley Wickham’s Advanced R info.
code: # filter the grid by viruses con$filterMabGrid(using = "virus", value = c("242-14", "Q23.17", "6535.3", "BaL.26", "DJ263.8"))  # filter the grid by donor species (llama) con$filterMabGrid(using = "donor_species", value = "llama")  # check the updated grid knitr::kable(con$mabGridSummary) con$resetMabGrid() con$   filterMabGrid(using = "virus", value = c("242-14", "Q23.17", "6535.3", "BaL.26", "DJ263.8"))$   filterMabGrid(using = "donor_species", value = "llama")$   mabGridSummary

what: Retrieve column values from the mAb grid
title: Accessing Monoclonal Antibody Data
text: can retrieve values grid mab_mixture, donor_species, isotype, hxb2_location, tier, clade, virus, studies, variables found mabGrid field connection object via data.table operations.
code: # retrieve available viruses in the filtered grid con$mabGrid[, unique(virus)] #> [1] "6535.3"  "Q23.17"  "DJ263.8" "BaL.26"  "242-14"  # retrieve available clades for 1H9 mAb mixture in the filtered grid con$mabGrid[mab_mixture == "1H9", unique(clade)] #> [1] "CRF02_AG" "B"

title: Accessing Monoclonal Antibody Data
text: filtering grid, can create DataSpaceMab object contains filtered mAb data. 6 public fields available DataSpaceMab object: studyAndMabs, mabs, nabMab, studies, assays, variableDefinitions, equivalent sheets excel file csv files download app via “Export Excel”/“Export CSV”.
code: mab <- con$getMab() mab #> <DataSpaceMab> #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org #>   User: jmtaylor@scharp.org #>   Summary: #>     - 3 studies #>     - 14 mAb mixtures #>     - 1 neutralization tiers #>     - 3 clades #>   Filters: #>     - virus: 242-14, Q23.17, 6535.3, BaL.26, DJ263.8 #>     - mab_donor_species: llama knitr::kable(con$mabGridSummary)

title: Accessing Non-Integrated Datasets
text: Methods DataSpace Study object allow see non-integrated data may available downloading . using HVTN 505 example. print method study object list available non-integrated datasets. availableDatasets property shows info available datasets, integrated field indicating whether data integrated. value n NA non-integrated data dataset loaded.
code: library(DataSpaceR) con <- connectDS() vtn505 <- con$getStudy("vtn505") vtn505 #> <DataSpaceStudy> #>   Study: vtn505 #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org/CAVD/vtn505 #>   Available datasets: #>     - Binding Ab multiplex assay #>     - Demographics #>     - Intracellular Cytokine Staining #>     - Neutralizing antibody #>   Available non-integrated datasets: #>     - ADCP #>     - Demographics (Supplemental) #>     - Fc Array knitr::kable(vtn505$availableDatasets)

title: Accessing Non-Integrated Datasets
text: Non-Integrated datasets can loaded getDataset like integrated data. unzip non-integrated data temp directory load environment. can also view file format info using getDatasetDescription. non-integrated data, open pdf computer’s default pdf viewer. Non-integrated data downloaded temp directory default. couple ways override desired. One specify outputDir calling getDataset getDatasetDescription. accessing data another time don’t want re-download , can change default directory whole study object setDataDir. dataset already exists specified dataDir outputDir, downloaded. can overridden reload=TRUE, forces re-download.
code: adcp <- vtn505$getDataset("ADCP") dim(adcp) #> [1] 378  11 colnames(adcp) #>  [1] "study_prot"             "participant_id"         "study_day"              #>  [4] "lab_code"               "specimen_type"          "antigen"                #>  [7] "percent_cv"             "avg_phagocytosis_score" "positivity_threshold"   #> [10] "response"               "assay_identifier" vtn505$getDatasetDescription("ADCP") vtn505$dataDir #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpoDO8Tc" vtn505$setDataDir(".") vtn505$dataDir #> [1] "/home/jmtaylor/Projects/DataSpaceR/vignettes"

title: Accessing Publication Data
text: DataSpaceConnection object includes methods browsing downloading publications publication data. DataSpaceConnection print method summarizes publications publication data. details publications can accessed con$availablePublications. table summarizes publications, providing information like first author, journal published, title data.table. also includes pubmed url available link. Related studies related_studies, related studies data available studies_with_data. can use data.table methods filter sort table browse available publications. example, can filter table view publications related particular study: publications related studies integrated data DataSpace: can also use information connect related studies pull integrated data. Say interested Rouphael (2019) publication: can find publication available publications table, determine related studies, pull data studies available. can see datasets available study. can pull using rouphael2019_study$getDataset().
code: library(DataSpaceR) library(data.table) con <- connectDS() con #> <DataSpaceConnection> #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org #>   User: jmtaylor@scharp.org #>   Available studies: 273 #>     - 77 studies with data #>     - 5049 subjects #>     - 423195 data points #>   Available groups: 3 #>   Available publications: 1530 #>     - 12 publications with data knitr::kable(head(con$availablePublications[, -"link"])) vtn096_pubs <- con$availablePublications[grepl("vtn096", related_studies)] knitr::kable(vtn096_pubs[, -"link"]) pubs_with_study_data <- con$availablePublications[!is.na(studies_with_data)] knitr::kable(head(pubs_with_study_data[, -"link"])) rouphael2019 <- con$availablePublications[first_author == "Rouphael NG"] knitr::kable(rouphael2019[, -"link"]) related_studies <- rouphael2019$related_studies related_studies #> [1] "vtn105" rouphael2019_study <- con$getStudy(related_studies) rouphael2019_study #> <DataSpaceStudy> #>   Study: vtn105 #>   URL: https://dataspace.cavd.org/CAVD/vtn105 #>   Available datasets: #>     - Binding Ab multiplex assay #>     - Demographics #>     - Intracellular Cytokine Staining #>     - Neutralizing antibody #>   Available non-integrated datasets: dim(rouphael2019_study$availableDatasets) #> [1] 4 4

title: Accessing Publication Data
text: DataSpace also includes publication datasets publications. format data vary publication publication, stored zip file. publication_data_available field specifies publications publication data available. Data publication can accessed DataSpaceR con$downloadPublicationData(). publication ID must specified, found publication_id con$availablePublications. file presented zip file. unzip argument gives us option whether unzip file. default, file unzipped. may also specify directory download file. default, saved Downloads directory. function invisibly returns paths downloaded files. , download data publication ID 1461 (Westling, 2020), view resulting downloads. zip files include file format document PDF, well README. documents give overview remaining contents files. case, data separated CD8+ T-cell responses CD4+ T-cell responses, described README.txt. publication also includes analysis scripts used publication, can allow users reproduce analysis results.
code: pubs_with_data <- con$availablePublications[publication_data_available == TRUE] knitr::kable(head(pubs_with_data[, -"link"])) publicationDataFiles <- con$downloadPublicationData("1461", outputDir = tempdir(), unzip = TRUE, verbose = TRUE) basename(publicationDataFiles) #> [1] "causal.isoreg.fns.R"           "CD.SuperLearner.R"             #> [3] "cd4_analysis.R"                "cd4_data.csv"                  #> [5] "cd8_analysis.R"                "cd8_data.csv"                  #> [7] "README.txt"                    "Westling_1461_file_format.pdf" cd4 <- fread(publicationDataFiles[grepl("cd4_data", publicationDataFiles)]) cd4 #>       pub_id age    sex      bmi   prot num_vacc dose response sexFemale #>   1: 069-071  23   Male 33.31000 vtn069        3  4.0        0         0 #>   2: 069-068  20 Female 32.74000 vtn069        3  4.0        1         1 #>   3: 069-020  19   Male 20.24000 vtn069        3  4.0        0         0 #>   4: 069-008  19 title: Interface to the CAVD DataSpace
text: DataSpaceR R interface CAVD DataSpace, data sharing discovery tool facilitates exploration HIV immunological data pre-clinical clinical HIV vaccine studies. package intended use immunologists, bioinformaticians, statisticians HIV vaccine research, anyone interested analysis HIV immunological data across assays, studies, time. package simplifies access database taking advantage standardization database hide Rlabkey specific code away user, allows users access study-specific datasets via object-oriented paradigm.

title: Interface to the CAVD DataSpace
text: detailed examples detailed documentation, see introductory vignette pkgdown site. quick guide use API, see cheat sheet .

title: Interface to the CAVD DataSpace
text: Install CRAN: can install latest development version GitHub devtools:
code: install.packages("DataSpaceR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/DataSpaceR")

title: Interface to the CAVD DataSpace
text: database accessed user’s credentials. netrc file storing login password information required. Create account read terms use R console, create netrc file using function DataSpaceR: create netrc file home directory. Alternatively, can manually create netrc file computer running R. Windows, file named _netrc UNIX, named .netrc file located user’s home directory, permissions file unreadable everybody except owner determine home directory, run Sys.getenv("HOME") R following three lines must included .netrc _netrc file either separated white space (spaces, tabs, newlines) commas. Multiple blocks can exist one file. See information netrc.
code: library(DataSpaceR) writeNetrc(   login = "yourEmail@address.com",    password = "yourSecretPassword",   netrcFile = "/your/home/directory/.netrc" # use getNetrcPath() to get the default path  ) machine dataspace.cavd.org login myuser@domain.com password supersecretpassword

title: Interface to the CAVD DataSpace

code: if (FALSE) { # Create a connection (Initiate a DataSpaceConnection object) con <- connectDS()  # Browse the mAb Grid con$mabGridSummary  # Filter the grid by viruses con$filterMabGrid(using = "virus", value = c("242-14", "Q23.17", "6535.3", "BaL.26", "DJ263.8"))  # Filter the grid by donor species (llama) con$filterMabGrid(using = "donor_species", value = "llama")  # Check the updated grid con$mabGridSummary  # Retrieve available viruses in the filtered grid con$mabGrid[, unique(virus)]  # Retrieve available clades for 1H9 mAb mixture in the filtered grid con$mabGrid[mab_mixture == "1H9", unique(clade)]  # Create a DataSpaceMab object that contains the filtered mAb data mab <- con$getMab() mab  # Inspect the `nabMab` field mab$nabMab }

Show NI data available datasets active binding allow users look NI (non-integrated) data DSR. Set active binding names snake case effort standardize fields names used API. Add authors publication table allow users find publication authors listed primary author.

title: DataSpaceR 0.7.4
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-26 Added virusMetadata field DataSpaceConnection shows virus metadata viruses used NAb assays (thanks @helenmiller16 #26) Added availablePublications field DataSpaceConnection summarizes available publications (thanks @helenmiller16 #27) Added downloadPublicationData method DataSpaceConnection download available publication data specified publication (thanks @helenmiller16 #27) Added vignette: Accessing Publication Data (thanks @helenmiller16 #27) Made PKMAb dataset available retrieve DataSpaceStudy (thanks @helenmiller16 @jmtaylor-fhcrc #27) Relaxed assumptions pulling non-integrated data, allows users pull non-integrated mab data, like cvd812. (thanks @helenmiller16 #28) Fixed test mabGridSummary$geometric_mean_curve_ic50 calculation reflect updated data. (thanks @helenmiller16 #28) Updated documentation using R6 documentation syntax roxygen
